title: Pony Express National Historic Trail: Crossing
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Partners     How to Create Your Sign Plan     The NHT Family of Signs and How to Use Them     Crossing                  Crossing Sign          Crossing signs are used to identify locations where the historic trail route crossed an existing road or highway. They help raise public awareness of the historic trail location. Ideally, these signs are used where evidence of the trail is still visible, but they may also be used where the trail is no longer visible. These signs can be used on almost all speeds and classes of roads, although you probably won't want to use them on high speed and interstate highways.
